009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
013import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
014import imagingbook.common.color.cie.CieUtils;
015import imagingbook.common.color.gamma.ModifiedGammaMapping;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018
019import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
020import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D65;
021
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * This class implements the sRGBcolor space with D65 white point. See Sec. 14.4 of [1] for details. Components of all
026 * {@code float[]} colors are supposed to be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use
027 * {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
031 * (2022).
032 * </p>
033 *
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/11/14
036 * @see LinearRgb65ColorSpace
037 */
038@SuppressWarnings("serial")
039public class sRGB65ColorSpace extends AbstractRgbColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
040        
041        // chromatic adaptation objects:
042        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
043        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
044        private static final ModifiedGammaMapping GammaMap = ModifiedGammaMapping.sRGB;
045
046        // tristimulus values and white point:
047        private static final double xR = 0.64, yR = 0.33;
048        private static final double xG = 0.30, yG = 0.60;
049        private static final double xB = 0.15, yB = 0.06;
050
051        private static final double[] W = D65.getXYZ();
052        private static final double[] xyW = D65.getXy();
053        
054        private static final sRGB65ColorSpace instance = new sRGB65ColorSpace();
055        
056        public static sRGB65ColorSpace getInstance() {
057                return instance;
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB. Its column vectors are the XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries.
062         */
063        // private static final double[][] Mrgbi =
064        //      {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
065        //       {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
066        //       {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
067        private final float[][] MrgbiF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgbi);
068        
069        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ (inverse of {@link #Mrgbi}). */
070        // private static final double[][] Mrgb = Matrix.inverse(Mrgbi);
071        private final float[][] MrgbF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgb);
072        
073        // ----------------------------------------------------
074        
075        // @Override
076        // public double[] getWhitePoint() {
077        //      return W;
078        // }
079        
080        // @Override
081        // public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
082        //      return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
083        // }
084        
085        // ----------------------------------------------------
086        
087        /** Constructor (not public). */
088        private sRGB65ColorSpace() {
089                super(xR, yR, xG, yG, xB, yB, xyW[0], xyW[1]);
090                // super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
091        }
092
093        // Methods required by ColorSpace (conversion from/to PCS space) ------------------
094
095        // assumes xyz50 is in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
096        @Override
097        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50PCS) {
098                float[] xyz65 = catD50toW.applyTo(xyz50PCS);    // to XYZ (D65)
099                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);                                // to sRGB
100        }
101
102        // returned colors are in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
103        @Override
104        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgbTHIS) {
105                float[] xyz65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(srgbTHIS);              // to XYZ (D65)
106                return catWtoD50.applyTo(xyz65);                                // to XYZ (D50)
107        }
108
109        
110        // direct conversion from/to D65-based XYZ space ------------------------------
111        
112        @Override       // converts from XYZ65 to this sRGB
113        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
114                float[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(MrgbF, xyz65);    // to linear RGB
115                return GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb);                                  // to non-linear sRGB
116        }
117        
118        @Override       // converts from sRGB to XYZ65
119        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] srgbTHIS) {
120                float[] rgb = GammaMap.applyInv(srgbTHIS);              // to linear rgb
121                return Matrix.multiply(MrgbiF, rgb);    // to XYZ (D65)
122        }
123        
124        // ----------------------------------------------------
125        
126        // @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
127        // public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
128        //      return srgb;
129        // }
130        //
131        // @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
132        // public float[] toRGB(float[] srgbTHIS) {
133        //      return srgbTHIS;
134        // }
135
136        public static void main(String[] args) {
137                PrintPrecision.set(9);
138                sRGB65ColorSpace CS = sRGB65ColorSpace.getInstance();
139
140                float[] wXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {1, 1, 1});
141                float[] rXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {1, 0, 0});
142                float[] gXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {0, 1, 0});
143                float[] bXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {0, 0, 1});
144                System.out.println("XYZ65 white = " + Matrix.toString(wXYZ));   // {0.964295685, 1.000000000, 0.825104535} = D65
145
146                System.out.println("XYZ65 red = " + Matrix.toString(rXYZ));     // {0.436065733, 0.222493172, 0.013923921}
147                System.out.println("XYZ65 grn = " + Matrix.toString(gXYZ));     //
148                System.out.println("XYZ65 blu = " + Matrix.toString(bXYZ));     //
149
150                System.out.println("xy65 red = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtils.XYZToxy(rXYZ)));    //
151                System.out.println("xy65 grn = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtils.XYZToxy(gXYZ)));    //
152                System.out.println("xy65 blu = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtils.XYZToxy(bXYZ)));    //
153
154                System.out.println("Mrgbi = \n" + Matrix.toString(CS.getMrgbi()));
155                System.out.println("Mrgb  = \n" + Matrix.toString(CS.getMrgb()));
156
157
158        }
159
160}
